GasUnitHeater.title: GasUnitHeater
GasUnitHeater.description: Gas unit heating system. Intended for spaces only requiring heating.

equipment_type.description: Text to indicate the type of air-side economizer used on the ideal air system. Economizers will mix in a greater amount of outdoor air to cool the zone (rather than running the cooling system) when the zone needs cooling and the outdoor air is cooler than the zone.

heater_efficiency.title: Heater Efficiency
heater_efficiency.description: A number for the efficiency of the heater within the system. For Gas systems, this is the efficiency of the burner. For HeatPump systems, this is the rated COP of the system. For electric systems, this should usually be set to 1. If set to Autocalculate, this value will automatically be set based on the equipment_type. Gas_WaterHeater - 0.8, Electric_WaterHeater - 1.0, HeatPump_WaterHeater - 3.5, Gas_TanklessHeater - 0.8, Electric_TanklessHeater - 1.0.

ambient_condition.title: Ambient Condition
ambient_condition.description: A number for the ambient temperature in which the hot water tank is located [C]. This can also be the identifier of a Room in which the tank is located.

ambient_loss_coefficient.title: Ambient Loss Coefficient
ambient_loss_coefficient.description: A number for the loss of heat from the water heater tank to the surrounding ambient conditions [W/K].

SHWSystem.title: SHWSystem
SHWSystem.description: Provides a model for a Service Hot Water system.

people_per_area.title: People Per Area
people_per_area.description: People per floor area expressed as [people/m2]

occupancy_schedule.title: Occupancy Schedule
occupancy_schedule.description: Identifier of a schedule for the occupancy over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the people_per_area to yield a complete occupancy profile.

activity_schedule.title: Activity Schedule
activity_schedule.description: Identifier of a schedule for the activity of the occupants over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be ActivityLevel and the values of the schedule equal to the number of Watts given off by an individual person in the room. If None, a default constant schedule with 120 Watts per person will be used, which is typical of awake, adult humans who are seated.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: The radiant fraction of sensible heat released by people. (Default: 0.3).

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the latent fraction of heat gain due to people or an Autocalculate object.

PeopleAbridged.title: PeopleAbridged
PeopleAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the use of lights over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete lighting profile.

visible_fraction.title: Visible Fraction
visible_fraction.description: The fraction of heat from lights that goes into the zone as visible (short-wave) radiation. (Default: 0.25).

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: The fraction of heat from lights that is long-wave radiation. (Default: 0.32).

return_air_fraction.title: Return Air Fraction
return_air_fraction.description: The fraction of the heat from lights that goes into the zone return air. (Default: 0).

baseline_watts_per_area.title: Baseline Watts Per Area
baseline_watts_per_area.description: The baseline lighting power density in [W/m2] of floor area. This baseline is useful to track how much better the installed lights are in comparison to a standard like ASHRAE 90.1. If set to None, it will default to 11.84029 W/m2, which is that ASHRAE 90.1-2004 baseline for an office.

LightingAbridged.title: LightingAbridged
LightingAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

ElectricEquipmentAbridged.title: ElectricEquipmentAbridged
ElectricEquipmentAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

GasEquipmentAbridged.title: GasEquipmentAbridged
GasEquipmentAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

flow_per_area.title: Flow Per Area
flow_per_area.description: Number for the total volume flow rate of water per unit area of floor [L/h-m2].

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the hot water use over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the flow_per_area to yield a complete water usage profile.

target_temperature.title: Target Temperature
target_temperature.description: Number for the target temperature of water out of the tap (C). This the temperature after hot water has been mixed with cold water from the water mains. The default is 60C, which essentially assumes that the flow_per_area on this object is only for water straight out of the water heater.

sensible_fraction.title: Sensible Fraction
sensible_fraction.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of the total hot water load given off as sensible heat in the zone.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of the total hot water load that is latent.

ServiceHotWaterAbridged.title: ServiceHotWaterAbridged
ServiceHotWaterAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

flow_per_exterior_area.title: Flow Per Exterior Area
flow_per_exterior_area.description: Number for the infiltration per exterior surface area in m3/s-m2.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the infiltration over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the flow_per_exterior_area to yield a complete infiltration profile.

InfiltrationAbridged.title: InfiltrationAbridged
InfiltrationAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

flow_per_person.title: Flow Per Person
flow_per_person.description: Intensity of ventilation in[] m3/s per person]. Note that setting this value does not mean that ventilation is varied based on real-time occupancy but rather that the design level of ventilation is determined using this value and the People object of the Room.

flow_per_area.title: Flow Per Area
flow_per_area.description: Intensity of ventilation in [m3/s per m2 of floor area].

air_changes_per_hour.title: Air Changes Per Hour
air_changes_per_hour.description: Intensity of ventilation in air changes per hour (ACH) for the entire Room.

flow_per_zone.title: Flow Per Zone
flow_per_zone.description: Intensity of ventilation in m3/s for the entire Room.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the ventilation over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the total design flow rate (determined from the sum of the other 4 fields) to yield a complete ventilation profile.

VentilationAbridged.title: VentilationAbridged
VentilationAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

cooling_schedule.title: Cooling Schedule
cooling_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the cooling setpoint. The values in this schedule should be temperature in [C].

heating_schedule.title: Heating Schedule
heating_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the heating setpoint. The values in this schedule should be temperature in [C].

humidifying_schedule.title: Humidifying Schedule
humidifying_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the humidification setpoint. The values in this schedule should be in [%].

dehumidifying_schedule.title: Dehumidifying Schedule
dehumidifying_schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the dehumidification setpoint. The values in this schedule should be in [%].

SetpointAbridged.title: SetpointAbridged
SetpointAbridged.description: Used to specify information about the setpoint schedule.

people.title: People
people.description: People to describe the occupancy of the program. If None, no occupancy will be assumed for the program.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.description: Lighting to describe the lighting usage of the program. If None, no lighting will be assumed for the program.

electric_equipment.title: Electric Equipment
electric_equipment.description: ElectricEquipment to describe the usage of electric equipment within the program. If None, no electric equipment will be assumed.

gas_equipment.title: Gas Equipment
gas_equipment.description: GasEquipment to describe the usage of gas equipment within the program. If None, no gas equipment will be assumed.

service_hot_water.title: Service Hot Water
service_hot_water.description: ServiceHotWater object to describe the usage of hot water within the program. If None, no hot water will be assumed.

infiltration.title: Infiltration
infiltration.description: Infiltration to describe the outdoor air leakage of the program. If None, no infiltration will be assumed for the program.

ventilation.title: Ventilation
ventilation.description: Ventilation to describe the minimum outdoor air requirement of the program. If None, no ventilation requirement will be assumed.

setpoint.title: Setpoint
setpoint.description: Setpoint object to describe the temperature and humidity setpoints of the program.  If None, the ProgramType cannot be assigned to a Room that is conditioned.

ProgramTypeAbridged.title: ProgramTypeAbridged
ProgramTypeAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

people_per_area.title: People Per Area
people_per_area.description: People per floor area expressed as [people/m2]

occupancy_schedule.title: Occupancy Schedule
occupancy_schedule.description: A schedule for the occupancy over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the people_per_area to yield a complete occupancy profile.

activity_schedule.title: Activity Schedule
activity_schedule.description: A schedule for the activity of the occupants over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be ActivityLevel and the values of the schedule equal to the number of Watts given off by an individual person in the room. If None, a default constant schedule with 120 Watts per person will be used, which is typical of awake, adult humans who are seated.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: The radiant fraction of sensible heat released by people. (Default: 0.3).

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the latent fraction of heat gain due to people or an Autocalculate object.

People.title: People
People.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for the use of lights over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete lighting profile.

visible_fraction.title: Visible Fraction
visible_fraction.description: The fraction of heat from lights that goes into the zone as visible (short-wave) radiation. (Default: 0.25).

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: The fraction of heat from lights that is long-wave radiation. (Default: 0.32).

return_air_fraction.title: Return Air Fraction
return_air_fraction.description: The fraction of the heat from lights that goes into the zone return air. (Default: 0).

baseline_watts_per_area.title: Baseline Watts Per Area
baseline_watts_per_area.description: The baseline lighting power density in [W/m2] of floor area. This baseline is useful to track how much better the installed lights are in comparison to a standard like ASHRAE 90.1. If set to None, it will default to 11.84029 W/m2, which is that ASHRAE 90.1-2004 baseline for an office.

Lighting.title: Lighting
Lighting.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

watts_per_area.title: Watts Per Area
watts_per_area.description: Equipment level per floor area as [W/m2].

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for the use of equipment over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete equipment profile.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: Number for the amount of long-wave radiation heat given off by equipment. Default value is 0.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the amount of latent heat given off by equipment. Default value is 0.

lost_fraction.title: Lost Fraction
lost_fraction.description: Number for the amount of “lost” heat being given off by equipment. The default value is 0.

ElectricEquipment.title: ElectricEquipment
ElectricEquipment.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

watts_per_area.title: Watts Per Area
watts_per_area.description: Equipment level per floor area as [W/m2].

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for the use of equipment over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete equipment profile.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: Number for the amount of long-wave radiation heat given off by equipment. Default value is 0.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the amount of latent heat given off by equipment. Default value is 0.

lost_fraction.title: Lost Fraction
lost_fraction.description: Number for the amount of “lost” heat being given off by equipment. The default value is 0.

GasEquipment.title: GasEquipment
GasEquipment.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

flow_per_area.title: Flow Per Area
flow_per_area.description: Number for the total volume flow rate of water per unit area of floor [L/h-m2].

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for the use of hot water over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the flow_per_area to yield a complete water usage profile.

target_temperature.title: Target Temperature
target_temperature.description: Number for the target temperature of water out of the tap (C). This the temperature after hot water has been mixed with cold water from the water mains. The default is 60C, which essentially assumes that the flow_per_area on this object is only for water straight out of the water heater.

sensible_fraction.title: Sensible Fraction
sensible_fraction.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of the total hot water load given off as sensible heat in the zone.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the fraction of the total hot water load that is latent.

ServiceHotWater.title: ServiceHotWater
ServiceHotWater.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

flow_per_exterior_area.title: Flow Per Exterior Area
flow_per_exterior_area.description: Number for the infiltration per exterior surface area in m3/s-m2.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: The schedule for the infiltration over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the flow_per_exterior_area to yield a complete infiltration profile.

Infiltration.title: Infiltration
Infiltration.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

flow_per_person.title: Flow Per Person
flow_per_person.description: Intensity of ventilation in[] m3/s per person]. Note that setting this value does not mean that ventilation is varied based on real-time occupancy but rather that the design level of ventilation is determined using this value and the People object of the Room.

flow_per_area.title: Flow Per Area
flow_per_area.description: Intensity of ventilation in [m3/s per m2 of floor area].

air_changes_per_hour.title: Air Changes Per Hour
air_changes_per_hour.description: Intensity of ventilation in air changes per hour (ACH) for the entire Room.

flow_per_zone.title: Flow Per Zone
flow_per_zone.description: Intensity of ventilation in m3/s for the entire Room.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Schedule for the ventilation over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the total design flow rate (determined from the sum of the other 4 fields) to yield a complete ventilation profile.

Ventilation.title: Ventilation
Ventilation.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

people.title: People
people.description: People to describe the occupancy of the program. If None, no occupancy will be assumed for the program.

lighting.title: Lighting
lighting.description: Lighting to describe the lighting usage of the program. If None, no lighting will be assumed for the program.

electric_equipment.title: Electric Equipment
electric_equipment.description: ElectricEquipment to describe the usage of electric equipment within the program. If None, no electric equipment will be assumed.

gas_equipment.title: Gas Equipment
gas_equipment.description: GasEquipment to describe the usage of gas equipment within the program. If None, no gas equipment will be assumed.

service_hot_water.title: Service Hot Water
service_hot_water.description: ServiceHotWater object to describe the usage of hot water within the program. If None, no hot water will be assumed.

infiltration.title: Infiltration
infiltration.description: Infiltration to describe the outdoor air leakage of the program. If None, no infiltration will be assumed for the program.

ventilation.title: Ventilation
ventilation.description: Ventilation to describe the minimum outdoor air requirement of the program. If None, no ventilation requirement will be assumed.

setpoint.title: Setpoint
setpoint.description: Setpoint object to describe the temperature and humidity setpoints of the program.  If None, the ProgramType cannot be assigned to a Room that is conditioned.

ProgramType.title: ProgramType
ProgramType.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

day_schedules.title: Day Schedules
day_schedules.description: A list of ScheduleDays that are referenced in the other keys of this ScheduleRulesetAbridged.

default_day_schedule.title: Default Day Schedule
default_day_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for all days when no ScheduleRule is applied. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

schedule_rules.title: Schedule Rules
schedule_rules.description: A list of ScheduleRuleAbridged that note exceptions to the default_day_schedule. These rules should be ordered from highest to lowest priority.

holiday_schedule.title: Holiday Schedule
holiday_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for holidays. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

summer_designday_schedule.title: Summer Designday Schedule
summer_designday_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for the summer design day. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

winter_designday_schedule.title: Winter Designday Schedule
winter_designday_schedule.description: An identifier for the ScheduleDay that will be used for the winter design day. This ScheduleDay must be in the day_schedules.

schedule_type_limit.title: Schedule Type Limit
schedule_type_limit.description: Identifier of a ScheduleTypeLimit that will be used to validate schedule values against upper/lower limits and assign units to the schedule values. If None, no validation will occur.

ScheduleRulesetAbridged.title: ScheduleRulesetAbridged
ScheduleRulesetAbridged.description: Used to define a schedule for a default day, further described by ScheduleRule.

values.title: Values
values.description: A list of timeseries values occuring at each timestep over the course of the simulation.

schedule_type_limit.title: Schedule Type Limit
schedule_type_limit.description: Identifier of a ScheduleTypeLimit that will be used to validate schedule values against upper/lower limits and assign units to the schedule values. If None, no validation will occur.

timestep.title: Timestep
timestep.description: An integer for the number of steps per hour that the input values correspond to.  For example, if each value represents 30 minutes, the timestep is 2. For 15 minutes, it is 4.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: A list of two integers for [month, day], representing the start date when the schedule values begin to take effect.A third integer may be added to denote whether the date should be re-serialized for a leap year (it should be a 1 in this case).

placeholder_value.title: Placeholder Value
placeholder_value.description: A value that will be used for all times not covered by the input values. Typically, your simulation should not need to use this value if the input values completely cover the simulation period.

interpolate.title: Interpolate
interpolate.description: Boolean to note whether values in between intervals should be linearly interpolated or whether successive values should take effect immediately upon the beginning time corresponding to them.

ScheduleFixedIntervalAbridged.title: ScheduleFixedIntervalAbridged
ScheduleFixedIntervalAbridged.description: Used to specify a start date and a list of values for a period of analysis.

construction_sets.title: Construction Sets
construction_sets.description: List of all ConstructionSets in the Model.

constructions.title: Constructions
constructions.description: A list of all unique constructions in the model. This includes constructions across all the Model construction_sets.

materials.title: Materials
materials.description: A list of all unique materials in the model. This includes materials needed to make the Model constructions.

hvacs.title: Hvacs
hvacs.description: List of all HVAC systems in the Model.

shws.title: Shws
shws.description: List of all Service Hot Water (SHW) systems in the Model.

program_types.title: Program Types
program_types.description: List of all ProgramTypes in the Model.

schedules.title: Schedules
schedules.description: A list of all unique schedules in the model. This includes schedules across all HVAC systems, ProgramTypes and ContextShades.

schedule_type_limits.title: Schedule Type Limits
schedule_type_limits.description: A list of all unique ScheduleTypeLimits in the model. This all ScheduleTypeLimits needed to make the Model schedules.

ModelEnergyProperties.title: ModelEnergyProperties
ModelEnergyProperties.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

sun_exposure.title: Sun Exposure
sun_exposure.description: A boolean noting whether the boundary is exposed to sun.

wind_exposure.title: Wind Exposure
wind_exposure.description: A boolean noting whether the boundary is exposed to wind.

view_factor.title: View Factor
view_factor.description: A number for the view factor to the ground. This can also be an Autocalculate object to have the view factor automatically calculated.

Outdoors.title: Outdoors
Outdoors.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

Ground.title: Ground
Ground.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

Adiabatic.title: Adiabatic
Adiabatic.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

width.title: Width
width.description: A number for the window width. Note that, if this width is applied to a wall that is too narrow for this width, the generated window will automatically be shortened when it is applied to the wall. In this way, setting the width to be `float("inf")` will create parameters that always generate a ribbon window.

height.title: Height
height.description: A number for the window height. Note that, if this height is applied to a wall that is too short for this height, the generated window will automatically be shortened when it is applied to the wall.

sill_height.title: Sill Height
sill_height.description: A number for the window sill height.

SingleWindow.title: SingleWindow
SingleWindow.description: A single window in the wall center defined by a width * height.

window_ratio.title: Window Ratio
window_ratio.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the ratio between the window area and the parent wall surface area.

SimpleWindowRatio.title: SimpleWindowRatio
SimpleWindowRatio.description: A single window defined by an area ratio with the base surface.

window_ratio.title: Window Ratio
window_ratio.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the ratio between the window area and the parent wall surface area.

window_height.title: Window Height
window_height.description: A number for the target height of the windows. Note that, if the window ratio is too large for the height, the ratio will take precedence and the actual window_height will be larger than this value.

sill_height.title: Sill Height
sill_height.description: A number for the target height above the bottom edge of the wall to start the windows. Note that, if the ratio is too large for the height, the ratio will take precedence and the sill_height will be smaller than this value.

horizontal_separation.title: Horizontal Separation
horizontal_separation.description: A number for the target separation between individual window centerlines.  If this number is larger than the parent rectangle base, only one window will be produced.

vertical_separation.title: Vertical Separation
vertical_separation.description: An optional number to create a single vertical separation between top and bottom windows.

RepeatingWindowRatio.title: RepeatingWindowRatio
RepeatingWindowRatio.description: Repeating windows derived from an area ratio with the base wall.

origins.title: Origins
origins.description: An array of 2D points within the plane of the wall for the origin of each window. Each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values. The wall plane is assumed to have an origin at the first point of the wall segment and an X-axis extending along the length of the segment. The wall plane Y-axis always points upwards. Therefore, both X and Y values of each origin point should be positive.

widths.title: Widths
widths.description: An array of positive numbers for the window widths. The length of this list must match the length of the origins.

heights.title: Heights
heights.description: An array of positive numbers for the window heights. The length of this list must match the length of the origins.

RectangularWindows.title: RectangularWindows
RectangularWindows.description: Several rectangular windows, defined by origin, width and height.

polygons.title: Polygons
polygons.description: An array of arrays with each sub-array representing a polygonal boundary of a window. Each sub-array should consist of arrays representing points, which can either contain 2 values (indicating they are 2D vertices within the plane of a parent wall segment) or they can contain 3 values (indicating they are 3D world coordinates). For 2D points, the wall plane is assumed to have an origin at the first point of the wall segment and an X-axis extending along the length of the segment. The wall plane Y-axis always points upwards. Therefore, both X and Y values of each point in the polygon should always be positive. Some sample code to convert from 2D vertices to 2D vertices in the plane of the wall can be found here: https://www.ladybug.tools/dragonfly-core/docs/dragonfly.windowparameter.html#dragonfly.windowparameter.DetailedWindows

DetailedWindows.title: DetailedWindows
DetailedWindows.description: Several detailed windows defined by 2D Polygons (lists of 2D vertices).

depth.title: Depth
depth.description: A number for the depth of the border.

ExtrudedBorder.title: ExtrudedBorder
ExtrudedBorder.description: Extruded borders over all windows in the wall.

depth.title: Depth
depth.description: A number for the overhang depth.

angle.title: Angle
angle.description: A number between -90 and 90 for the for an angle to rotate the overhang in degrees. 0 indicates an overhang perpendicular to the wall. Positive values indicate a downward rotation. Negative values indicate an upward rotation.

Overhang.title: Overhang
Overhang.description: A single overhang over an entire wall.

distance.title: Distance
distance.description: A number for the approximate distance between each louver.

LouversByDistance.title: LouversByDistance
LouversByDistance.description: A series of louvered Shades at a given distance between each louver.

louver_count.title: Louver Count
louver_count.description: A positive integer for the number of louvers to generate.

LouversByCount.title: LouversByCount
LouversByCount.description: A specific number of louvered Shades over a wall.

min_indoor_temperature.title: Min Indoor Temperature
min_indoor_temperature.description: A number for the minimum indoor temperature at which to ventilate in Celsius. Typically, this variable is used to initiate ventilation.

max_indoor_temperature.title: Max Indoor Temperature
max_indoor_temperature.description: A number for the maximum indoor temperature at which to ventilate in Celsius. This can be used to set a maximum temperature at which point ventilation is stopped and a cooling system is turned on.

min_outdoor_temperature.title: Min Outdoor Temperature
min_outdoor_temperature.description: A number for the minimum outdoor temperature at which to ventilate in Celsius. This can be used to ensure ventilative cooling does not happen during the winter even if the Room is above the min_indoor_temperature.

max_outdoor_temperature.title: Max Outdoor Temperature
max_outdoor_temperature.description: A number for the maximum indoor temperature at which to ventilate in Celsius. This can be used to set a limit for when it is considered too hot outside for ventilative cooling.

delta_temperature.title: Delta Temperature
delta_temperature.description: A number for the temperature differential in Celsius between indoor and outdoor below which ventilation is shut off.  This should usually be a positive number so that ventilation only occurs when the outdoors is cooler than the indoors. Negative numbers indicate how much hotter the outdoors can be than the indoors before ventilation is stopped.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the ventilation over the course of the year. Note that this is applied on top of any setpoints. The type of this schedule should be On/Off and values should be either 0 (no possibility of ventilation) or 1 (ventilation possible).

VentilationControlAbridged.title: VentilationControlAbridged
VentilationControlAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

fraction_area_operable.title: Fraction Area Operable
fraction_area_operable.description: A number for the fraction of the window area that is operable.

fraction_height_operable.title: Fraction Height Operable
fraction_height_operable.description: A number for the fraction of the distance from the bottom of the window to the top that is operable

discharge_coefficient.title: Discharge Coefficient
discharge_coefficient.description: A number that will be multipled by the area of the window in the stack (buoyancy-driven) part of the equation to account for additional friction from window geometry, insect screens, etc. Typical values include 0.45, for unobstructed windows WITH insect screens and 0.65 for unobstructed windows WITHOUT insect screens. This value should be lowered if windows are of an awning or casement type and are not allowed to fully open.

wind_cross_vent.title: Wind Cross Vent
wind_cross_vent.description: Boolean to indicate if there is an opening of roughly equal area on the opposite side of the Room such that wind-driven cross ventilation will be induced. If False, the assumption is that the operable area is primarily on one side of the Room and there is no wind-driven ventilation.

flow_coefficient_closed.title: Flow Coefficient Closed
flow_coefficient_closed.description: An optional number in kg/s-m, at 1 Pa per meter of crack length, used to calculate the mass flow rate when the opening is closed; required to run an AirflowNetwork simulation. The DesignBuilder Cracks template defines the flow coefficient for a tight, low-leakage closed external window to be 0.00001, and the flow coefficient for a very poor, high-leakage closed external window to be 0.003.

flow_exponent_closed.title: Flow Exponent Closed
flow_exponent_closed.description: An optional dimensionless number between 0.5 and 1 used to calculate the mass flow rate when the opening is closed; required to run an AirflowNetwork simulation. This value represents the leak geometry impact on airflow, with 0.5 generally corresponding to turbulent orifice flow and 1 generally corresponding to laminar flow. The default of 0.65 is representative of many cases of wall and window leakage, used when the exponent cannot be measured.

two_way_threshold.title: Two Way Threshold
two_way_threshold.description: A number in kg/m3 indicating the minimum density difference above which two-way flow may occur due to stack effect, required to run an AirflowNetwork simulation. This value is required because the air density difference between two zones (which drives two-way air flow) will tend towards division by zero errors as the air density difference approaches zero. The default of 0.0001 is a typical default value used for AirflowNetwork openings.

VentilationOpening.title: VentilationOpening
VentilationOpening.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

FuelTypes.title: FuelTypes
FuelTypes.description: Designates the acceptable fuel types for process loads.

watts.title: Watts
watts.description: A number for the process load power in Watts.

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the use of the process over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts to yield a complete equipment profile.

fuel_type.description: Text to denote the type of fuel consumed by the process. Using the "None" type indicates that no end uses will be associated with the process, only the zone gains.

end_use_category.title: End Use Category
end_use_category.description: Text to indicate the end-use subcategory, which will identify the process load in the end use output. For example, “Cooking”, “Clothes Drying”, etc. A new meter for reporting is created for each unique subcategory.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: Number for the amount of long-wave radiation heat given off by the process load. Default value is 0.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the amount of latent heat given off by the process load. Default value is 0.

lost_fraction.title: Lost Fraction
lost_fraction.description: Number for the amount of “lost” heat being given off by the process load. The default value is 0.

ProcessAbridged.title: ProcessAbridged
ProcessAbridged.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

construction_set.title: Construction Set
construction_set.description: Name of a ConstructionSet to specify all constructions for the Room2D. If None, the Room2D will use the Story or Building construction_set or the Model global_construction_set. Any ConstructionSet assigned here will override those assigned to these objects.

program_type.title: Program Type
program_type.description: Name of a ProgramType to specify all schedules and loads for the Room2D. If None, the Room2D will have no loads or setpoints.

hvac.title: Hvac
hvac.description: An optional identifier of a HVAC system (such as an IdealAirSystem) that specifies how the Room2D is conditioned. If None, it will be assumed that the Room2D is not conditioned.

shw.title: Shw
shw.description: An optional identifier of a Service Hot Water (SHW) system that specifies how the hot water load of the Room is met. If None, the hot water load will be met with a generic system that only measures thermal loadand does not account for system efficiencies.

window_vent_control.title: Window Vent Control
window_vent_control.description: An optional VentilationControl object to dictate the opening of windows. If None, the windows will never open.

window_vent_opening.title: Window Vent Opening
window_vent_opening.description: An optional VentilationOpening to specify the operable portion of all windows of the Room2D. If None, the windows will never open.

process_loads.title: Process Loads
process_loads.description: An optional list of of Process objects for process loads within the room. These can represent kilns, manufacturing equipment, and various industrial processes. They can also be used to represent wood burning fireplaces or certain pieces of equipment to be separated from the other end uses.

Room2DEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: Room2DEnergyPropertiesAbridged
Room2DEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

floor_boundary.title: Floor Boundary
floor_boundary.description: A list of 2D points representing the outer boundary vertices of the Room2D. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 2 (x, y) values.

floor_height.title: Floor Height
floor_height.description: A number to indicate the height of the floor plane in the Z axis.

floor_to_ceiling_height.title: Floor To Ceiling Height
floor_to_ceiling_height.description: A number for the distance between the floor and the ceiling.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

floor_holes.title: Floor Holes
floor_holes.description: Optional list of lists with one list for each hole in the floor plate. Each hole should be a list of at least 2 points and each point a list of 2 (x, y) values. If None, it will be assumed that there are no holes in the floor plate.

is_ground_contact.title: Is Ground Contact
is_ground_contact.description: A boolean noting whether this Room2D has its floor in contact with the ground.

is_top_exposed.title: Is Top Exposed
is_top_exposed.description: A boolean noting whether this Room2D has its ceiling exposed to the outdoors.

boundary_conditions.title: Boundary Conditions
boundary_conditions.description: A list of boundary conditions that match the number of segments in the input floor_geometry + floor_holes. These will be used to assign boundary conditions to each of the walls of the Room in the resulting model. Their order should align with the order of segments in the floor_boundary and then with each hole segment. If None, all boundary conditions will be Outdoors or Ground depending on whether ceiling height of the room is at or below 0 (the assumed ground plane).

window_parameters.title: Window Parameters
window_parameters.description: A list of WindowParameter objects that dictate how the window geometries will be generated for each of the walls. If None, no windows will exist over the entire Room2D.

shading_parameters.title: Shading Parameters
shading_parameters.description: A list of ShadingParameter objects that dictate how the shade geometries will be generated for each of the walls. If None, no shades will exist over the entire Room2D.

air_boundaries.title: Air Boundaries
air_boundaries.description: A list of booleans for whether each wall has an air boundary type. False values indicate a standard opaque type while True values indicate an AirBoundary type. All walls will be False by default. Note that any walls with a True air boundary must have a Surface boundary condition without any windows.

Room2D.title: Room2D
Room2D.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

construction_set.title: Construction Set
construction_set.description: Name of a ConstructionSet to specify all constructions for the Story. If None, the Story will use the Building construction_set or the Model global_construction_set. Any ConstructionSet assigned here will override those assigned to these objects.

StoryEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: StoryEnergyPropertiesAbridged
StoryEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

room_2ds.title: Room 2Ds
room_2ds.description: An array of dragonfly Room2D objects that together form an entire story of a building.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

floor_to_floor_height.title: Floor To Floor Height
floor_to_floor_height.description: A number for the distance from the floor plate of this story to the floor of the story above this one (if it exists). If Autocalculate, this value will be the maximum floor_to_ceiling_height of the input room_2ds.

floor_height.title: Floor Height
floor_height.description: A number to indicate the height of the floor plane in the Z axis.If Autocalculate, this will be the minimum floor height of all the room_2ds, which is suitable for cases where there are no floor plenums.

multiplier.title: Multiplier
multiplier.description: An integer that denotes the number of times that this Story is repeated over the height of the building.

Story.title: Story
Story.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

n.title: N
n.description: Plane normal as 3 (x, y, z) values.

o.title: O
o.description: Plane origin as 3 (x, y, z) values

x.title: X
x.description: Plane x-axis as 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it is autocalculated.

Plane.title: Plane
Plane.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

boundary.title: Boundary
boundary.description: A list of points representing the outer boundary vertices of the face. The list should include at least 3 points and each point should be a list of 3 (x, y, z) values.

holes.title: Holes
holes.description: Optional list of lists with one list for each hole in the face.Each hole should be a list of at least 3 points and each point a list of 3 (x, y, z) values. If None, it will be assumed that there are no holes in the face.

plane.title: Plane
plane.description: Optional Plane indicating the plane in which the face exists.If None, the plane will usually be derived from the boundary points.

Face3D.title: Face3D
Face3D.description: A single planar face in 3D space.

construction_set.title: Construction Set
construction_set.description: Name of a ConstructionSet to specify all constructions for the Building. If None, the Model global_construction_set will be used.

BuildingEnergyPropertiesAbridged.title: BuildingEnergyPropertiesAbridged
BuildingEnergyPropertiesAbridged.description:
Base class for all objects that are not extensible with additional keys.

This effectively includes all objects except for the Properties classes
that are assigned to geometry objects.

unique_stories.title: Unique Stories
unique_stories.description: An array of unique dragonfly Story objects that together form the entire building. Stories should generally be ordered from lowest floor to highest floor. Note that, if a given Story is repeated several times over the height of the building, the unique story included in this list should be the first (lowest) story of the repeated floors.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

Building.title: Building
Building.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: An array of planar Face3Ds that together represent the context shade.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

ContextShade.title: ContextShade
ContextShade.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

buildings.title: Buildings
buildings.description: A list of Buildings in the model.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Extension properties for particular simulation engines (Radiance, EnergyPlus).

version.title: Version
version.description: Text string for the current version of the schema.

context_shades.title: Context Shades
context_shades.description: A list of ContextShades in the model.

units.description: Text indicating the units in which the model geometry exists. This is used to scale the geometry to the correct units for simulation engines like EnergyPlus, which requires all geometry be in meters.

tolerance.title: Tolerance
tolerance.description: The maximum difference between x, y, and z values at which vertices are considered equivalent. This value should be in the Model units and is used in a variety of checks and operations. A value of 0 will result in bypassing all checks so it is recommended that this always be a positive number when checks have not already been performed on a Model. The default of 0.01 is suitable for models in meters.

angle_tolerance.title: Angle Tolerance
angle_tolerance.description: The max angle difference in degrees that vertices are allowed to differ from one another in order to consider them colinear. This value is used in a variety of checks and operations that can be performed on geometry. A value of 0 will result in no checks and an inability to perform certain operations so it is recommended that this always be a positive number when checks have not already been performed on a given Model.

Model.title: Model
Model.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

vintage.description: Text for the vintage of the template system. This will be used to set efficiencies for various pieces of equipment within the system. Further information about these defaults can be found in the version of ASHRAE 90.1 corresponding to the selected vintage. Read-only versions of the standard can be found at: https://www.ashrae.org/technical-resources/standards-and-guidelines/read-only-versions-of-ashrae-standards

sensible_heat_recovery.title: Sensible Heat Recovery
sensible_heat_recovery.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the effectiveness of sensible heat recovery within the system.

latent_heat_recovery.title: Latent Heat Recovery
latent_heat_recovery.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the effectiveness of latent heat recovery within the system.

demand_controlled_ventilation.title: Demand Controlled Ventilation
demand_controlled_ventilation.description: Boolean to note whether demand controlled ventilation should be used on the system, which will vary the amount of ventilation air according to the occupancy schedule of the Rooms.

doas_availability_schedule.title: Doas Availability Schedule
doas_availability_schedule.description: An optional On/Off discrete schedule to set when the dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS) shuts off. This will not only prevent any outdoor air from flowing thorough the system but will also shut off the fans, which can result in more energy savings when spaces served by the DOAS are completely unoccupied. If None, the DOAS will be always on.

vintage.description: Text for the vintage of the template system. This will be used to set efficiencies for various pieces of equipment within the system. Further information about these defaults can be found in the version of ASHRAE 90.1 corresponding to the selected vintage. Read-only versions of the standard can be found at: https://www.ashrae.org/technical-resources/standards-and-guidelines/read-only-versions-of-ashrae-standards

_TemplateSystem.title: _TemplateSystem
_TemplateSystem.description: Base class for HVAC systems following a standards template.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

IDdEnergyBaseModel.title: IDdEnergyBaseModel
IDdEnergyBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Text string for a unique object ID. This identifier remains constant as the object is mutated, copied, and serialized to different formats (eg. dict, idf, osm). This identifier is also used to reference the object across a Model. It must be < 100 characters, use only ASCII characters and exclude (, ; ! \n \t).

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: Display name of the object with no character restrictions.

EnergyBaseModel.title: EnergyBaseModel
EnergyBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects requiring a valid EnergyPlus identifier.

interior_construction.title: Interior Construction
interior_construction.description: Identifier for an OpaqueConstruction for faces with a Surface or Adiabatic boundary condition.

exterior_construction.title: Exterior Construction
exterior_construction.description: Identifier for an OpaqueConstruction for faces with an Outdoors boundary condition.

ground_construction.title: Ground Construction
ground_construction.description: Identifier for an OpaqueConstruction for faces with a Ground boundary condition.

_FaceSubSetAbridged.title: _FaceSubSetAbridged
_FaceSubSetAbridged.description: A set of constructions for wall, floor, or roof assemblies.

DatedBaseModel.title: DatedBaseModel
DatedBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects needing to check for a valid Date.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Text string for a unique object ID. This identifier remains constant as the object is mutated, copied, and serialized to different formats (eg. dict, idf, rad). This identifier is also used to reference the object across a Model. It must be < 100 characters and not contain any spaces or special characters.

display_name.title: Display Name
display_name.description: Display name of the object with no character restrictions.

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Optional dictionary of user data associated with the object.All keys and values of this dictionary should be of a standard data type to ensure correct serialization of the object (eg. str, float, int, list).

IDdBaseModel.title: IDdBaseModel
IDdBaseModel.description: Base class for all objects requiring a identifiers acceptable for all engines.

vintage.description: Text for the vintage of the template system. This will be used to set efficiencies for various pieces of equipment within the system. Further information about these defaults can be found in the version of ASHRAE 90.1 corresponding to the selected vintage. Read-only versions of the standard can be found at: https://www.ashrae.org/technical-resources/standards-and-guidelines/read-only-versions-of-ashrae-standards

_HeatCoolBase.title: _HeatCoolBase
_HeatCoolBase.description: Base class for all heating/cooling systems without any ventilation.

window_construction.title: Window Construction
window_construction.description: A WindowConstructionAbridged object that serves as the "switched off" version of the construction (aka. the "bare construction"). The shade_material and shade_location will be used to modify this starting construction.

shade_material.title: Shade Material
shade_material.description: Identifier of a An EnergyWindowMaterialShade or an EnergyWindowMaterialBlind that serves as the shading layer for this construction. This can also be an EnergyWindowMaterialGlazing, which will indicate that the WindowConstruction has a dynamically-controlled glass pane like an electrochromic window assembly.

shade_location.description: Text to indicate where in the window assembly the shade_material is located.  Note that the WindowConstruction must have at least one gas gap to use the "Between" option. Also note that, for a WindowConstruction with more than one gas gap, the "Between" option defalts to using the inner gap as this is the only option that EnergyPlus supports.

control_type.description: Text to indicate how the shading device is controlled, which determines when the shading is “on” or “off.”

setpoint.title: Setpoint
setpoint.description: A number that corresponds to the specified control_type. This can be a value in (W/m2), (C) or (W) depending upon the control type.Note that this value cannot be None for any control type except "AlwaysOn."

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: An optional schedule identifier to be applied on top of the control_type. If None, the control_type will govern all behavior of the construction.

WindowConstructionShadeAbridged.title: WindowConstructionShadeAbridged
WindowConstructionShadeAbridged.description: Construction for window objects with an included shade layer.

interior_construction.title: Interior Construction
interior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with a Surface or Adiabatic boundary condition.

exterior_construction.title: Exterior Construction
exterior_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with an Outdoors boundary condition.

ground_construction.title: Ground Construction
ground_construction.description: An OpaqueConstruction for walls with a Ground boundary condition.

_FaceSubSet.title: _FaceSubSet
_FaceSubSet.description: A set of constructions for wall, floor, or roof assemblies.

watts_per_area.title: Watts Per Area
watts_per_area.description: Equipment level per floor area as [W/m2].

schedule.title: Schedule
schedule.description: Identifier of the schedule for the use of equipment over the course of the year. The type of this schedule should be Fractional and the fractional values will get multiplied by the watts_per_area to yield a complete equipment profile.

radiant_fraction.title: Radiant Fraction
radiant_fraction.description: Number for the amount of long-wave radiation heat given off by equipment. Default value is 0.

latent_fraction.title: Latent Fraction
latent_fraction.description: Number for the amount of latent heat given off by equipment. Default value is 0.

lost_fraction.title: Lost Fraction
lost_fraction.description: Number for the amount of “lost” heat being given off by equipment. The default value is 0.

_EquipmentBase.title: _EquipmentBase
_EquipmentBase.description: Base class for all objects requiring an EnergyPlus identifier and user_data.

depth.title: Depth
depth.description: A number for the depth to extrude the louvers.

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: A number for the distance to louvers from the wall.

angle.title: Angle
angle.description: A number between -90 and 90 for the for an angle to rotate the louvers in degrees. 0 indicates louvers perpendicular to the wall. Positive values indicate a downward rotation. Negative values indicate an upward rotation.

contour_vector.title: Contour Vector
contour_vector.description: A list of two float values representing the (x, y) of a 2D vector for the direction along which contours are generated. (0, 1) will generate horizontal contours, (1, 0) will generate vertical contours, and (1, 1) will generate diagonal contours.

flip_start_side.title: Flip Start Side
flip_start_side.description: Boolean to note whether the side the louvers start from should be flipped. Default is False to have contours on top or right. Setting to True will start contours on the bottom or left.

_LouversBase.title: _LouversBase
_LouversBase.description: Base class for for a series of louvered shades over a wall.

vintage.description: Text for the vintage of the template system. This will be used to set efficiencies for various pieces of equipment within the system. Further information about these defaults can be found in the version of ASHRAE 90.1 corresponding to the selected vintage. Read-only versions of the standard can be found at: https://www.ashrae.org/technical-resources/standards-and-guidelines/read-only-versions-of-ashrae-standards

economizer_type.description: Text to indicate the type of air-side economizer used on the system (from the AllAirEconomizerType enumeration).

sensible_heat_recovery.title: Sensible Heat Recovery
sensible_heat_recovery.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the effectiveness of sensible heat recovery within the system.

latent_heat_recovery.title: Latent Heat Recovery
latent_heat_recovery.description: A number between 0 and 1 for the effectiveness of latent heat recovery within the system.

demand_controlled_ventilation.title: Demand Controlled Ventilation
demand_controlled_ventilation.description: Boolean to note whether demand controlled ventilation should be used on the system, which will vary the amount of ventilation air according to the occupancy schedule of the Rooms.

type.title: Type
type.description: A base class to use when there is no baseclass available to fall on.
